info.headline: Heat Advisory issued September 04 at 6:56PM EDT until September 07 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TUESDAY TO 7 PM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heat index values up to 98 expected. * WHERE...Grand Isle, Orange and Eastern Windsor Counties. * WHEN...From 1 PM Tuesday to 7 PM EDT Thursday. Hottest conditions will occur between noon and 7 PM each day. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur, especially from noon to 7 PM each day. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will cool each night through Thursday, but may only dip into the mid 60s to around 70 degrees briefly early each morning. The duration of cooling may not be sufficient to effectively cool a home or other structures, allowing for heat impacts to accumulate each day.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
